entry.title: John Caffey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Caffey (pictured) was the first to describe the condition now known as shaken baby syndrome?

entry.title: Loli (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that people in Loli traditionally derive their social identity from the village in which they were born?

entry.title: Thomas Jeremiah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas Jeremiah, a slaveowner, was executed for inciting a slave insurrection?

entry.title: Don't Pay UK (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Don't Pay UK plan to encourage UK households to cancel their energy bill payments on 1 October 2022 if their pledge reaches 1 million signatures?

entry.title: PJ and Thomas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that PJ and Thomas were the first gay couple to host an HGTV show?

entry.title: Donald Trump disinvited the Philadelphia Eagles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2018, Donald Trump disinvited the Philadelphia Eagles from a Super Bowl LII victory ceremony at the White House after several players said they were not going to attend?

entry.title: siege of Petra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the end of the siege of Petra in 551 AD, the Romans discovered that there was yet another pipe beneath the ones they destroyed that was supplying water to the besieged garrison all along?

entry.title: Edward N. Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Edward N. Hall is known as the "father of the Minuteman ICBM" but his brother Ted was a Soviet spy?
